text: The Curtiss XP-18 was ordered in 1930 and was to have been a single-seat biplane powered by a Wright IV-1560 engine. The design was cancelled before Curtiss constructed any.Fahey, James C.,US Army Aircraft 1908-1946, 1946, Ships and Aircraft, New York. ==References== Category:Cancelled military aircraft projects of the United States P-18 Category:Single-engine aircraft Category:Biplanes
title: Curtiss XP-18
